radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal-size uterus (5.9 cm in length), abnormally heterogeneous and thickened endometrial lining (measuring up to 1 cm), normal kidneys and ovaries.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.date: 1 month after the completion of therapy
radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of cancer in the chest or upper abdomen, but soft-tissue densities in the pelvis thought to be resolving postoperative inflammatory changes.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.date: 11 months after the completion of chemotherapy
radiographic_examinations.findings: Occlusion of the inferior vena cava by a circumferential retroperitoneal soft-tissue mass measuring approximately 4 cm and two lesions in the liver (approximately 5 mm in greatest dimension).

radiographic_examinations.date: 11 days after the previous CT scan
radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked FDG avidity in the retroperitoneal mass and liver lesions, increased size and number of liver lesions since the previous CT scan, and a focus of intense tracer uptake in the L2 vertebral body consistent with metastasis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increasing size and number of liver lesions since the previous CT scan.
